text: in my life it was very important that my
parents put the goals at the highest
that I should challenge Cafaro whom be
the world champion my father had a very
special ID and stoughton way the way he
wanted to raise his kids he believed
that it will be the best if you were
homeschooled but much more focusing on
daily bases and playing chess I have two
sister Susan the oldest she's 7 years
older than I am and I have another
sister Sophia I was about five years old
when I started to play chess it was very
clear that I'm I'm talented I play good
I started to play against the adults
from very young age practically from
very beginning Judith from Budapest was
up against Israeli Grandmaster Yair
Kreitman needing just a draw to win the
whole tournament
she easily took the title I was the only
girl player most of the time already in
those competitions it was difficult for
me to get used to the fact that I'm
playing there alone with all those guys
Kasparov was the world champion already
in 88 when I met him and he was watching
my game that's what I heard from other
people were telling me and it gave a lot
of inspiration that I knew that already
he look what's going on when will there
be a woman will champion
well maybe she's sitting next to me I
was training daily many hours and made
lot of efforts and and everything in
order that I get into the top elite
between the male players
I played the viscous part of starting
from 94 in many different occasions and
it was a very special psychological mess
with Kasparov for many many years I sit
down at the table I have all the respect
to him he is the world champion and then
somehow you don't have the
self-confidence the knowledge he has
this appearance that you should know
already before the game that who wins
the game right
it was Russia against rest of the world
I was part of the rest of the world
theme somehow he choose the very bad
opening I think it was the Berlin
defense and I took my chances I played
the solid game and he made few mistakes
and I took advantage of them on Geary
you can see it very well with his body
language his movements he's shaking his
hand holding his head and of course I
saw it on the board what's going on when
he resigned it was very clear that
doesn't make any sense to play longer he
was very much annoyed that he didn't
give a great fight it was kind of a
historical moment that I I won finally a
game against Garry Kasparov it was very
very special
